page.title: 11Dialects and accent
page.content: The people of Kirkby speak with the same accent as the people in Liverpool. This is because the town was an overspill area built to help the Liverpool slum clearance programme . Although the accent is the same as Liverpool the children of Kirkby are developing their own slang words . An example of this is the use of the word "bizzies"for the police . Unlike other towns where the accent becomes steadily diluted the further moves from the town ,the Kirkby accent and dialect ends on the boundaries . Nearby villages , such as Rainford and Bickerstaffe , have their own Lancashire accent and dialect.
